text: A field extension K is a field containing a given field k as a subfield. The notation K/k means that K is an extension of the field k. K is sometimes called an overfield of the field k. == Algebraic over k == An element of the field K is called algebraic over k if it satisfies some algebraic equation with coefficients in k, and transcendental otherwise. == References == Category:Algebraic number theory
title: Field extension
